headerDisplay: For help and support please visit our GitHub Wiki. We hope you find this plugin useful!

mode.title: Device Detection
mode.description: This setting defines how the plugin finds your devices.

discoveryInterval.title: Refresh Interval
discoveryInterval.description: An interval (in seconds) in which the plugin will initally find and continually check device connections. Must be 15 or more.

disableDeviceLogging.title: Disable Device Logging
disableDeviceLogging.description: Global logging setting for accessory status changes. If true then accessory status changes will not be logged. This can also be set per accessory later in the config.

debug.title: Debug Logging
debug.description: Global logging setting for the plugin. If true then debug information will be added to the log. This can also be set per accessory later in the config.

debugFakegato.title: Debug Fakegato
debugFakegato.description: If true, the included Fakegato library will debug to the log.

debugNodeSSDP.title: Debug Fakegato
debugNodeSSDP.description: If true, the included node-ssdp library will debug to the log.

disablePlugin.title: Disable Plugin
disablePlugin.description: If true, the plugin will remove all accessories and not load the plugin on restart.

label.title: Label
label.description: This setting has no effect except to be a helpful label for identifying which device this is when editing the configuration.

makerTimer.title: Open/Close Time
makerTimer.description: The time in seconds for how long it takes the garage door to open/close. Must be 1 or more.

overrideLogging.title: Override Logging Setting
overrideLogging.description: Override global logging setting for this device.

showTodayTC.title: Show Today's Consumption
showTodayTC.description: If true, today's consumption will show in the Eve app's Total Consumption field instead of the cumulative value.

wattDiff.title: Limit Wattage Logging (by wattage)
wattDiff.description: The plugin will not log device wattage if the difference from the previous value is less than this number. Must be 1 or more.

timeDiff.title: Limit Wattage Logging (by time)
timeDiff.description: The plugin will not log device wattage if the time difference (in seconds) from the previous value is less than this number. Must be 1 or more.

overrideLogging.title: Override Logging Setting
overrideLogging.description: Override global logging setting for this device.

serialNumber.description: In the case of a Wemo Bulb (via Link) please use the device ID of the bulb, not the serial number of the Link.

brightnessStep.title: Brightness Step
brightnessStep.description: A minimum step for the brightness slider in the Home app. Must be 1 or more.

adaptiveLightingShift.title: Adaptive Lighting Shift
adaptiveLightingShift.description: An adjustment factor for Adaptive Lighting. The mired value for each update will be increased by this setting, making the light appear warmer. A value in the range 50-200 should be appropriate. Must be 0 or more.

transitionTime.title: Transition Time
transitionTime.description: Transition time (in seconds?) for brightness and colour temperature changes. Applies to Wemo Bulb (not Dimmer). Must be 0 or more.

pollingInterval.title: Polling Interval
pollingInterval.description: Newer models of the Wemo Dimmer may require polling (in seconds) for brightness updates. Must be 15 or more.

items.title: Device IP/URL
items.description: Specify a device's IP and the plugin will try to determine the correct port. You can also specify a full address to specify both the IP and the port, e.g. http://192.168.1.1:49153/setup.xml.

items.title: Serial Number
items.description: The serial number of the device that should be ignored. In the case of a Wemo Bulb (via Link) please use the device ID of the bulb, not the serial number of the Link.

listen_interface.title: Listener Interface
listen_interface.description: This can be used to specify which network interface to listen on. If blank then by default the server will listen on all interfaces, however, Wemo subscription messages will only be sent to the first non-internal IPv4 address returned by os.networkInterfaces() after being sorted by compatible network which may or may not be what you want.

port.title: Listener Port
port.description: This can be used to specify a port to bind to for listening to UPnP events. If blank or 0 then the plugin will listen on any available randomly selected port.

interfaces.title: SSDP Interfaces
interfaces.description: A comma separated list of interfaces to explicitly bind to. If blank then bind to all available interfaces.

explicitSocketBind.title: SSDP Explicit Socket Bind
explicitSocketBind.description: Bind sockets to each discovered interface explicitly instead of relying on the system. Might help with issues with multiple NICs.
